title: COVID-19 Vaccination
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccination On This Page Vaccination Policy Due to recent updates in recommendations from the CDC, the UCOP policy is under review. We anticipate that once each year, typically in the fall, UCSC will require students to either attest to being vaccinated against COVID-19, or submit an opt out/declination form. You do not need to take any action for COVID or flu at this time. [Visit this link for updates and communications on how to attest or decline](https://healthcenter.ucsc.edu/services/immunizations.html), when the process becomes available later this year. For staff and faculty COVID-19 information please visit the [Risk Services department website](https://risk.ucsc.edu/covid-19-support/index.html). Cost On-campus COVID-19 vaccines will be free to all registered UCSC students. Off campus locations will vary, please check with the particular clinic you are visiting. The University of California, Student Health Insurance Plan (UC SHIP) does not require a referral for off campus COVID-19 vaccinations or COVID-19 diagnostic testing, retroactive to March 2020. A referral is needed if any other service is performed during the visit. The COVID-19 immunization is a preventative service and as such there is no out-of-pocket cost to the student when the service is performed by an in-network Anthem PPO provider. If you have paid out of pocket for any of these services or have received a bill from a provider for these services, please see the message on the [UC Student Health Insurance Plan](https://www.ucop.edu/ucship/) website to learn about your options. Find a COVID-19 Vaccine Students can call the Health Center to make an appointment for the COVID-19 booster. Find vaccine providers in your community at [Vaccines.gov.](https://www.vaccines.gov/) Vaccine FAQ and Resources COVID-19 vaccines are safe, effective, and free. Get answers to [frequently asked questions](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/faq.html) about vaccines. View the UCSC campus [COVID-19 FAQ](https://healthcenter.ucsc.edu/services/covid-19/covid19-faq.html). - [Learn about the different vaccines, safety, possible side effects](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html)and get other questions answered. - [Get your digital vaccine proof through](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html) [California's Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record website](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) - Students with non-urgent COVID-19 questions: Log into Health e-Messenger and select Messages > New Message, COVID-19 Questions
